#include <stdio.h>

#include <string.h>

#include <ctype.h>

#define MAX_LINE 100

#define MAX_RES 200

int is_punctuation(char c) {

    char *punctuations = ",.!?";

    for (int i=0; punctuations[i] != '\0'; i++) {

        if (c == punctuations[i]) return 1;

    }

    return 0;

}

int main() {

    char line[MAX_LINE];

    fgets(line, sizeof(line), stdin);

    char sa[20], sb[20];

    sscanf(line, "%s %s", sa, sb);

    int a = atoi(sa);

    float f = atof(sb);

    int b = (int)(f * 100 + 0.1);

    int res1 = (a * b) / 100;

    char s[20];

    sprintf(s, "%d", res1);

    // Now process s through the second program's logic.

    char res[MAX_RES] = {0};

    int pos =0;

    int len = strlen(s);

    for (int i=0; i < len; i++) {

        char c = s[i];

        if (i ==0) {

            if (isspace(c)) {

                continue;

            } else if (is_punctuation(c)) {

                continue;

            } else {

                res[pos++] = c;

            }

        } else {

            if (isspace(c)) {

                if (pos ==0 || res[pos-1] != ' ') {

                    res[pos++] = ' ';

                }

            } else if (is_punctuation(c)) {

                if (pos >0 && res[pos-1] == ' ') {

                    pos--; // remove the last space

                }

                res[pos++] = c;

                res[pos++] = ' '; // add space after punctuation

            } else {

                res[pos++] = c;

            }

        }

    }

    // Now, check if the last character is a space and remove it.

    if (pos >0 && res[pos-1] == ' ') {

        pos--;

    }

    res[pos] = '\0';

    printf("%s\n", res);

    return 0;

}
